question:
The Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana (PMVVY):
  1. is being implemented by the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) of India
  2. provides an assured return of 8% per annum for 10 years
  3. is available for individuals who are aged between 18â€“60 years
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First and second statements are correct</u>. <u>Third statement is incorrect</u> because the scheme is available for senior citizens aged 60 years or more. The Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana (PNVVY) was launched in May 2017 to provide social security during old age. The scheme is being implemented by the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) of India. Under the scheme, on payment of an initial lump sum amount ranging from Rs 1.5 Lakh for a minimum pension of Rs 1000 per month to a maximum of Rs 7.5 Lakhs for a maximum pension of Rs 5,000 per month, subscribers will get an assured pension based on a guaranteed rate of return of 8% per annum payable monthly/quarterly/half-yearly/annually.
